isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - CAB: 5000, 9100, 9200, 9300, 9400 - REMOVE AND INSTALL - REAR WINDOW GLASS AND WEATHER SEAL (EXCEPT SLEEPER MODELS)

svcproc.title: REAR WINDOW GLASS AND WEATHER SEAL (EXCEPT SLEEPER MODELS)

svcprocinfo.para: Refer to Figure 18 for Items in parentheses unless otherwise noted.

calloutgroup.callout1: 3. SLIDE WINDOW IN DIRECTION OF ARROW

svcprocinfo.para: A one-piece weather seal (Item 1) secures the rear window glass (Item 2) to the cab. The weather seal is molded to fit tightly over a flange at the edge of the window opening so it secures the glass in the window opening.

note.para: Because old weather seals are likely to be damaged, always install a new seal when replacing the glass.
Use only heat treated glass (AS-2 per 226.1-1966).

svcsubproc.title: Remove and Install

step1.para: For easy removal of the weather seal (Item 1) and rear window glass (Item 2), cut away the portion of weather seal that fits around the window flange.

Clean the window flange. Apply soapy solution to the window flange channels of the weather seal (Item 1) to ease installation. Locate the vulcanized joint at the top center of the rear window opening, then install the new weather seal around the perimeter.

Install the rear window glass (Item 2) from outside the cab. Start the glass into the channels on the driver side (left), and push the glass to the right (Item 3). Use the weather seal tool ( Item 2, Figure 19) to seat the edge of the weather seal ( Item 1, Figure 19) over the right side of the glass. Then install the left end of the glass.

calloutgroup.callout1: 3. PULL TOOL IN DIRECTION OF ARROW

step1.para: Insert the weather seal tool ( Item 2, Figure 19) into the seal so it catches the inner seal, then pull the tool all the way around the seal to fully seat the seal lip.

svcsubproc.para:
Refer to SPECIAL TOOLS
for the correct tool to remove and install the rear window glass.

note.para: Do not overseal the lips ( Figure 12 and Figure 13). If the lips are oversealed, run the weather seal tool over area again.
